metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2385 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the encode_msg function in encode_msg.c in the SEAS module in Kamailio (formerly OpenSER and SER) before 4.3.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and process crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a large SIP packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-2385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

kamailio - 4.4.0-1
kamailio-autheph-modules - 4.4.0-1
kamailio-berkeley-bin - 4.4.0-1
kamailio-berkeley-modules - 4.4.0-1
kamailio-cnxcc-modules - 4.4.0-1
kamailio-cpl-modules - 4.4.0-1
kamailio-erlang-modules - 4.4.0-1

kamailio-geoip-modules - 4.4.0-1

kamailio-ims-modules - 4.4.0-1

kamailio-phonenum-modules - 4.4.0-1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: kamailio package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1').
